body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.):


**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.):
delete pod
delete pod uid
---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one):
maybe a bug report: the "kubectl delete pod [uid]" doesn't work.

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.1+82450d0", GitCommit:"59619aa9d1b0481460e9de029408b3bac82ca5d4", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2017-01-10T00:30:53Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.1+82450d0", GitCommit:"59619aa9d1b0481460e9de029408b3bac82ca5d4", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2017-01-10T00:26:06Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

**What happened**:
First, use "kubectl get pod [podname] -o yaml" to get the details of the pod, obtaining the uid under metadata.uid. Then use "kubectl delete pod [uid]" to delete the pod, but failed finally. the info showed like this: Error from server (NotFound): pods "8a2ff4bf-dbf8-11e6-818c-4437e63c5ac5" not found.
Did I get the wrong uid?

**What you expected to happen**:
It should delete pod successfully just like using podname.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
just do like mentioned in "What happened"

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: "kubectl delete pod [uid]" doesn't work
